$eref.description: Element to capture creation and last update data.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of access data between parties.

___created.description: Date and time the access group was created: Month, day, year and optionally hour, minute, second of day, in ISO 8601 format.

Element to capture creation and last update data.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Text_Paragraph.description: Used to reflect contract details linked to a profile.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___EffectiveExpireDate.description: Provides the effective and expiry dates for the alliance partnership.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___id.description: Identification of the alliance or partnership.

___birthDate.description: The birth date of the document holder.

___EffectiveExpireDate.description: The effective and expiry date of the document.

___birthPlace.description: Specifies the birth place of the document holder (e.g., city, state, county, province), when designating a country of birth, use BirthCountry.

___docID.description: Unique number assigned by authorities to document.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of document data between parties.

___holderType.description: Provides the type of document holder.

___contactName.description: Provides contact name associated with the document.

___gender.description: The gender of the document holder.

___docIssueAuthority.description: Indicates the group or association that granted the document.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the document.

___DocType.description: Indicates the type of document (e.g. Passport, Military ID, Drivers License, national ID, Vaccination Certificate). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Document Type (DOC).

___docHolderNationality.description: The country code of the nationality of the document holder.

___docIssueStateProv.description: State or Province where the document was issued.

___postalCode.description: Defines the postal code (e.g., ZIP code) on the document.

___docIssueCountry.description: Country where the document was issued.

___birthCountry.description: Specifies the birth country of the document holder.

___docIssueLocation.description: Indicates the location where the document was issued.

___EffectiveExpireDate.description: Used to identify the effective date and/or expiration date.

___policyNumber.description: Identifier assigned by insurance company to the insurance policy.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___id.description: A unique reference for this insurance policy within this message.

___insuranceType.description: Type of insurance policy carried by the individual or company.

___EffectiveExpireOptionalDateGroup.description: Used to send the effective date and/or expiration date.

___defaultInd.description: Indicates whether the organization is the default choice among several.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___OrganizationMemberName.description: Name of the member of the organization, as listed among the options of customer names.

___officeLocation.description: Specifes the location type of an office (e.g. main, field, division).

___Person_Name.description: This provides name information for a person.

$eref.description: Root element for profile content.

___Identifier.description: Globally unique identifier for this profile.

___id.description: This is a reference placeholder, used as an index for this guest in this reservation.

___DateTimeStamp.description: Creation date time, creator ID, last modification date time and last modifier ID.

___Agreements.description: Agreement information related to the profile.

___Type.description: Used to specify a profile type.

___Status.description: Status of the profile. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Profile Status Code (PST).

___ShareAll.description: Used to indicate whether information can be shared.

___Person.description: Detailed customer information for this profile.

___Company.description: Company information related to the profile.

___Affiliations.description: Affiliation information related to the profile.

___Accesses.description: A collection of actions taken on a record.

$eref.description: Root element for profile content.

___relation.description: Indicates the type of relationship with the person in the profile, such as Spouse, Child, Family, Business Associate, Interest Group, Medical, Security, Other, etc.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of related traveler data between parties.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the travel arranger.

___defaultInd.description: Indicates that the receiving system should assume the default value if the user specifies no overriding value or action.

___type.description: Type of service making travel plans or transactions (e.g., travel agency, etc.).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of travel arranger data between parties.

___CompanyName.description: Company name of the travel arranger.

___id.description: A unique reference for a travel arranger within this message.

___description.description: A description of the trip purpose.

___code.description: A code identifiying the purpose of the trip.

___Company.description: Company that defines the list of purpose codes.
Company that defines the list of purpose codes.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___RequiredPayment.description: A deposit policy that is associated to this company.

___TravelArranger.description: Information on the organization responsible for arranging travel for the company.

___FormOfPayment.description: Method of providing funds for travel by the company.

___CurrencyCode.description: The currency used by this company.

___Trip_Purposes.description: Trip purpose codes used by this company.

___TravelArranger.description: The organization responsible for arranging travel for the employer.

___EffectiveExpireDate.description: Used to send the effective date and/or expiration date.

___officeType.description: Designates the office category within an organization.

___department.description: The department name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___InternalReferenceNumber.description: Accounting code(s) assigned to travel for employer.

___division.description: The division name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___Identifier.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

___id.description: Provides a unique reference to this contact person.

___birthDate.description: The birth date of the person.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Telephone.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___maritalStatus_Enum.description: Specifies the marital status of the person.

___deceasedInd.description: When true the customer is deceased.

___vIP_Ind.description: If true, indicates a very important person.

___previouslyMarriedInd.description: When true, indicates the customer was previously married. When false, indicates the customer was not previously married.

___children.description: The number of children of the customer.

___customerValue.description: The supplier's ranking of the customer (e.g., VIP, numerical ranking).

___PayloadStdAttributes.description: The standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel messages.
The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel Messages.

___Profile.description: The profile created by the request,  may only include the identifier for the profile and not the full profile information.

___Result.description: When present indicates that errors or warnings occurred during processing.

___Profile.description: Identifies the profile to be deleted, may only include the idenfier for the profile to be deleted.

___OTA_PayloadStdAttributes.description: The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel Messages.

___Profile.description: The profile deleted by the request, may only include the identifier for the profile. and not the full profile information.

___OTA_PayloadStdAttributes.description: The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel Messages.

___Result.description: When present indicates that errors or warnings occurred during processing.

___Profile.description: Identifies the profile to be read,  may only include the identifier for the profile and not the full profile information.

___Profile.description: The updated profile,  may only include the identifier for the profile and not the full profile information.

$eref.description: Element to capture creation and last update data.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

$eref.description: Free text comment added by the person accessing the profile record.

___name.description: Name of individual who originated or updated record.

___action.description: Type of action taken on the profile.

___date.description: Month, day, year and optionally in hour, minute, second of day in ISO 8601 format of the action taken on the profile.

___system.description: The identifier of the system that performed the action on the profile record.

$eref.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of access data between parties.

___created.description: Date and time the access group was created: Month, day, year and optionally hour, minute, second of day, in ISO 8601 format.

Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

_88Certification.description: Information about certifications or accreditation held by the company.

___expireDateExclusiveInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

$eref.description:
A long string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 4096

___certId.description: The Certification Identification number assigned to a business entity by the certifying body. This number would presumably be the ID in the Unique ID.

A string intended for free text 
Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096

___freeText.description: Textual information to provide descriptions and/or additional information.

___codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

___memberCode.description: Identifies the alliance or consortium member by code.

___code.description: Identifies a company by the company code.

___department.description: The department name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___division.description: The division name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___shortName.description: Used to provide the company common name.

$eref.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___id.description: Identification of the alliance or partnership.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___defaultInd.description: Indicates that the receiving system should assume the default value if the user specifies no overriding value or action.

___contactType.description: Type of contact in the context of use for the travel experience; such as permanent, temporary, affiliation, travel arranger, etc.

___relation.description: Indicates the type of relationship with the person or company in the profile, such as Spouse, Child, Family, Business Associate, Interest Group, Medical, Security,Other, etc.

___Person.description: Information regarding the contact such as name, address, phone, etc.

___documentDistribMethodCode.description: Indicates the method of distribution for the booking documentation. Refer to OpenTravel Code list Distribution Type (DTB).

___communicationMethodCode.description: Provides the preferred method of communication. Refer to OpenTravel Code list Distribution Type (DTB).

___RequiredPayment.description: A deposit policy that is associated to this company.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the travel arranger.

___defaultInd.description: Indicates that the receiving system should assume the default value if the user specifies no overriding value or action.

___type.description: Type of service making travel plans or transactions (e.g., travel agency, etc.).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of travel arranger data between parties.

___CompanyName.description: Company name of the travel arranger.

___id.description: A unique reference for a travel arranger within this message.

___TravelArranger.description: Information on the organization responsible for arranging travel for the company.

$eref.description: Specifies the form of payment.

___FormOfPayment.description: Method of providing funds for travel by the company.

$eref.description: An ISO 4217 (3) alpha character code that specifies a monetary unit.

___DecimalPlaces.description: The ISO 4217 standard "minor unit" is typically used when the amount provided includes the minor unit of currency without a decimal point (e.g., USD 8500 needs DecimalPlaces="2" to represent $85).

___CurrencyCode.description: The currency used by this company.

___Company.description: Company that defines the list of purpose codes.

___Trip_Purposes.description: Trip purpose codes used by this company.

$eref.description: Identifies a company by name.

___codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

___code.description: Identifies a company by the company code.

___department.description: The department name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___division.description: The division name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___shortName.description: Used to provide the company common name.

$eref.description: Identifies a membership or loyalty program offered by the company by name of the program.

___primaryInd.description: When true, indicates this is the primary loyalty program and when absent or false, indicates this is not the primary loyalty program.

___codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

___loyaltyLevel.description: Indicates special privileges in program assigned to individual.

___singleVendorIndGroupInd.description: Present and true Indicates the program is part of an alliance, otherwise it is a single vendor.

___id.description: A unique reference for a loyalty program within this message.

___programCode.description: Identification of the loyalty program by code.

$eref.description: Base type for SOAP request messages.
Root element for profile content.

___Identifier.description: Globally unique identifier for this profile.

___id.description: This is a reference placeholder, used as an index for this guest in this reservation.

$eref.description: The standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel messages.

___echoToken.description: Implementer: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

___retransmissionIndicatorInd.description: Implementer: It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to TRUE) only when a message is retransmitted.

___targetName.description: The name of the Test or Production system.

___target.description: Test or Production target system indicator.

___version.description: The OpenTravel message version indicated by a decimal value.

___sequenceNmbr.description: Implementer: Message resynchronization typically is required if a system has been off-line and needs to retrieve messages that were missed.

___transactionIdentifier.description: Unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

___timeStamp.description:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock:
20 November 2003, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2003-11-20T13:59:38Z

___correlationID.description: Allows end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

___transactionStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

___OTA_PayloadStdAttributes.description: The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel Messages.

___Profile.description: The updated profile,  may only include the identifier for the profile and not the full profile information.

___Status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the Status_Enum(NotProcessed | Incomplete | Complete | Unknown) however, the data type is designated an open enumeration, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

___Result.description: When present indicates that errors or warnings occurred during processing.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

___defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

___type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

___Person_Document.description: Document  information for verification purposes and also used for additional filtering for common names.

$eref.description: Base type for SOAP request messages.
The standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel messages.

___echoToken.description: Implementer: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

___retransmissionIndicatorInd.description: Implementer: It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to TRUE) only when a message is retransmitted.

___targetName.description: The name of the Test or Production system.

___target.description: Test or Production target system indicator.

___version.description: The OpenTravel message version indicated by a decimal value.

___sequenceNmbr.description: Implementer: Message resynchronization typically is required if a system has been off-line and needs to retrieve messages that were missed.

___transactionIdentifier.description: Unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

___timeStamp.description:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock:
20 November 2003, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2003-11-20T13:59:38Z

___correlationID.description: Allows end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

___transactionStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

___PayloadStdAttributes.description: The standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel messages.

$eref.description: Root element for profile content.

___Identifier.description: Globally unique identifier for this profile.

___id.description: This is a reference placeholder, used as an index for this guest in this reservation.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

$eref.description: Root element for profile content.

___Identifier.description: Globally unique identifier for this profile.

___id.description: This is a reference placeholder, used as an index for this guest in this reservation.

___Profile.description: The profile created by the request,  may only include the identifier for the profile and not the full profile information.

___Status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the Status_Enum(NotProcessed | Incomplete | Complete | Unknown) however, the data type is designated an open enumeration, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

___Result.description: When present indicates that errors or warnings occurred during processing.

___language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

___defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

___type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

___Person_Document.description: Document  information for verification purposes and also used for additional filtering for common names.

___Person_Name.description: This provides name information for a person.

$eref.description: Employment identification; using an employee ID number, title, level within the company, and an indication of their status (e.g., active, retired, on leave, or terminated from employment).  Additional information about an employee can be entered into the element, including the name of the employee, if it differs from the person name identified as a customer or contact.

___description.description: Description of the staff tour code.

___level.description: Level in employer organization (e.g. seniority) that coveys privileges.

___title.description: Title of employee in the employer company that conveys rank or privileges.

___employer.description: The airlineThe empoyer to which the EmployeeID is associated.

___id.description: Identifier assigned to the employee.

___birthDate.description: The birth date of the document holder.

___EffectiveExpireDate.description: The effective and expiry date of the document.

___policyNumber.description: Identifier assigned by insurance company to the insurance policy.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___id.description: A unique reference for this insurance policy within this message.

___insuranceType.description: Type of insurance policy carried by the individual or company.

$eref.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___EffectiveExpireOptionalDateGroup.description: Used to send the effective date and/or expiration date.

___defaultInd.description: Indicates whether the organization is the default choice among several.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___OrganizationMemberName.description: Name of the member of the organization, as listed among the options of customer names.

___officeLocation.description: Specifes the location type of an office (e.g. main, field, division).

___MemberIdentifier.description: Identifier assigned to person registered with travel club.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Date_EffectiveExpire.description: Used to identify the effective date and/or expiration date.

_88Access.description: Free text comment added by the person accessing the profile record.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___name.description: Name of individual who originated or updated record.

___action.description: Type of action taken on the profile.

___date.description: Month, day, year and optionally in hour, minute, second of day in ISO 8601 format of the action taken on the profile.

___system.description: The identifier of the system that performed the action on the profile record.

$eref.description: Base type for SOAP request messages.
Root element for profile content.

___Identifier.description: Globally unique identifier for this profile.

___id.description: This is a reference placeholder, used as an index for this guest in this reservation.

___Profile.description: Identifies the profile to be deleted, may only include the idenfier for the profile to be deleted.

$eref.description: The standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel messages.

___echoToken.description: Implementer: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

___retransmissionIndicatorInd.description: Implementer: It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to TRUE) only when a message is retransmitted.

___targetName.description: The name of the Test or Production system.

___target.description: Test or Production target system indicator.

___version.description: The OpenTravel message version indicated by a decimal value.

___sequenceNmbr.description: Implementer: Message resynchronization typically is required if a system has been off-line and needs to retrieve messages that were missed.

___transactionIdentifier.description: Unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

___timeStamp.description:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock:
20 November 2003, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2003-11-20T13:59:38Z

___correlationID.description: Allows end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

___transactionStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

___OTA_PayloadStdAttributes.description: The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel Messages.

A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___relation.description: Indicates the type of relationship with the person in the profile, such as Spouse, Child, Family, Business Associate, Interest Group, Medical, Security, Other, etc.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

$eref.description: Contains information about agreements for commission arrangements with the business entity.

___currencyCode.description: An ISO 4217 (3) alpha character code that specifies a monetary unit.

___currency_Amount.description: Provides a monetary amount and the currency code to reflect the currency in which this amount is expressed.

___decimalPlaces.description: Implementer: The ISO 4217 standard "minor unit" is typically used when the amount provided includes the minor unit of currency without a decimal point (e.g., USD 8500 needs DecimalPlaces="2" to represent $85).

___codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

___planCode.description: Identifies a commission plan agreement between trading partners by plan code.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

$eref.description: Information about certifications or accreditation held by the company.

___expireDateExclusiveInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

___certId.description: The Certification Identification number assigned to a business entity by the certifying body. This number would presumably be the ID in the Unique ID.

___singleVendorIndGroupInd.description: TODO - what is this? Indicates the alliance status of the company.

___freeText.description: Textual information to provide descriptions and/or additional information.
